snippet: The authorities said laptops and the Internet were used in more than two dozen countries to steal from A.T.M.’s, including 2,904 machines in New York City, in one day.
abstract: Authorities say thieves, in two precision operations that involved people in more than 24 countries acting in close coordination and with surgical precision, stole $45 million from thousands of automatic teller machines in matter of hours; in New York City alone, thieves responsible for ATM withdrawals struck 2,904 machines over 10 hours starting on Feb 19, withdrawing $2.4 million; operation included computer experts as well as common street criminals.

byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth, Frances Robles and Mosi Secret contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The authorities said laptops and the Internet were used in more than two dozen countries to steal from A.T.M.’s, including 2,904 machines in New York City, in one day.

headline.main: In Hours, Thieves Took $45 Million in A.T.M. Scheme
